item.title: Lance add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Dependence begets subservience and venality, suffocates the germ of virtue, and prepares fit tools for the designs of ambition." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lance add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lance add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A person that started in to carry a cat home by the tail was gitting knowledge that was always going to be useful to him, and warn't ever going to grow dim or doubtful." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lance add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Civilization is a limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessaries." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lance add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lance add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on the installment plan." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lance add a quote by henry david thoreau
item.description: "if i repent of anything, it is very likely to be my good behavior. what demon possessed me that i behaved so well?" -- henry david thoreau

item.title: Lance add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Wars are poor chisels for carving out peaceful tomorrows." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lance add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Lance add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "You'll never get ahead of anyone as long as you try to get even with him." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Lance add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Lance add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Lance add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "By the skillful and sustained use of propaganda, one can make a people see even heaven as hell or an extremely wretched life as paradise." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Lance add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "It is not truth that matters, but victory." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Lance add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "The great strength of the totalitarian state is that it forces those who fear it to imitate it." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Lance add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "The very first essential for success is a perpetually constant and regular employment of violence." -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Lance add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Lance add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Prohibition... goes beyond the bounds of reason in that it attempts to control a man's appetite by legislation and makes a crime out of things that are not crimes... A prohibition law strikes a blow at the very principles upon which our government was founded." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Lance add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lance add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Lance add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Lance add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Lance add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:Dâ€™Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Gerald R. Ford
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have." -- Gerald R. Ford

item.title: Lance add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I wish that all nations may recover and retain their independence; that those which are overgrown may not advance beyond safe measures of power, that a salutary balance may be ever maintained among nations, and that our peace, commerce, and friendship, may be sought and cultivated by all. It is our business to manufacture for ourselves whatever we can, to keep our markets open for what we can spare or want; and the less we have to do with the amities or enmities of Europe, the better. Not in our day, but at no distant one, we may shake a rod over the heads of all, which may make the stoutest of them tremble. <b>But I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that <i>the less we use our power, the greater it will be</i></b>." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lance add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I sincerely believe that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies, and that the principle of spending money to be paid by posterity, under the name of funding, is but swindling futurity on a large scale." -- Thomas Jefferson
